heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Fines (Payment and
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Fines (Payment and 

Recovery) Act 2014 (Section 6) (Amendment) Regulations 2023. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on the 24th day of January

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)), hereby
Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 2. The Fines (Payment and Recovery) Act 2014 (Section 6) Regulations
text_raw:
2. The Fines (Payment and Recovery) Act 2014 (Section 6) Regulations 
2016 (S.I. No 13 of 2016) are amended by the substitution of the following 
Regulation for Regulation 7: 

“7. For the purposes of section 6(1)(b) of the Act, the following are 
prescribed as the means for paying a fine through the Courts Service - 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

cash, 

cheque, 

bank draft, 

postal money order, 

credit card, or 

debit card.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

23 January, 2023. 

SIMON HARRIS, 

Minister for Justice. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 27th January, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [9] 3
